text: exercise 3 let's practice working with
different verb tenses change the active
to passive example Vincent van Gogh
painted a starry night and when we
change it it becomes a starry night was
painted by Vincent van Gogh the active
verb was painted the passive verb was
painted number one I'll read the
sentence you change it and then I'll
tell you the answer
Jennifer built of the fire
the fire was built by Jennifer -
Jennifer was building the fire
the fire was being built by Jennifer
three Jennifer had built the fire
the fire had been built by Jennifer
for Jennifer built the fire
the fire is built by Jennifer
five jennifer is building the fire the
fire is being built by jennifer six
jennifer has built the fire the fire has
been built by jennifer seven jennifer is
going to build the fire the fire is
going to be built by Jennifer
eight Jennifer will build the fire the
fire will be built by Jennifer nine
Jennifer will have built the fire the
fire will have been built by Jennifer
number 10 this reminds you that we can
use the passive in questions as well did
Jennifer build the fire was the fire
built by Jennifer now let's talk about
why we use the passive why do we use the
passive there are several reasons
let's name each one the person or thing
performing the action is unknown and in
this case there will be no by phrase
this picture was taken of me when I was
about four years old and honestly I do
not know who took it the person or thing
performing the action is not important
and again here the by-phrase will not be
used sometimes it's a combination of
reasons the person or thing performing
the action is not important or maybe
it's not even known now in this bag of
walnuts the allergy information states
that this product is processed on
equipment that also processes other tree
nuts or peanuts do we know exactly who
processed this product no and it's not
important to know it's clear to everyone
who or what performed the action and in
such sentences again we wouldn't use a
bio phrase because it's unnecessary
here are some leftovers
I made a tasty dinner the other night
this chicken was baked in the oven with
tomatoes green peppers jalapenos and
lots of herbs who did the baking I did
of course we want to avoid stating who
or what performed the action so
naturally if we don't want to State who
or what did something we don't use a bio
phrase let's say my husband asks why is
the milk warm I might answer because it
was left out for a while
and you see I do this because I don't
want to admit that I'm the one who
forgot to put it away we want to
highlight someone's work and often it's
artistic or a creative work this
concerto was written by Beethoven and by
using the passive I'm recognizing that
it was Beethoven who was responsible for
this musical composition exercise for
read each statement and explain why the
passive voice is used example our mail
is delivered at the same time every day
why is the passive used in this sentence
because it's obvious it's clear to
everyone that the person who delivers
the mail is the mail carrier
these jeans were made in Hong Kong why
is the passive used we don't know
exactly who made these jeans and it's
not important to know
this blanket was crocheted by my friend
why is the passive used here
because I'm giving credit to my friend
for her creative work honey the trash
bags weren't put in the trash cans it
looks kind of messy don't you think
why is the passive used here
to avoid an argument
here are my books they were written for
English language learners
why is the passive used here because
it's clear from context that I'm the one
who wrote them
[Music]
exercise five we're almost at the end of
our lesson so this is a short exercise
to pull it all together listen to the
description of the painting and try to
understand why the passive is used this
is a watercolor I love this painting it
was made by a student of mine a very
young student in Russia I had written
some children's stories and I asked her
to illustrate them and to this day this
watercolor remains one of my favorites
this is a story about an alien and on
his planet there was a terrible
rainstorm all the colors were washed
away the alien was given a magic
paintbrush and with the paintbrush he is
able to paint all the colors back on his
planet again this is a watercolor I love
this painting it was made by a student
of mine a very young student in Russia I
had written some children's stories and
I asked her to illustrate them and to
this day this watercolor remains one of
my favorites this is a story about an
alien and on his planet there was a
terrible rainstorm all the colors were
washed away the alien was given a magic
paintbrush and with the paintbrush he is
able to paint all the colors back on his
planet again that's all for now be sure
to check back because there will be more
lessons on the passive it's quite a
broad topic thanks for watching and
happy studies
